techmeme.title: The Biden-Harris administration launches a Reddit White House account for news and info about federal government work; first posts are about Hurricane Helene (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
Marketing tech company Zeta Global agrees to buy LiveIntent, another marketing tech provider, for $250M in cash and stock in a deal expected to close in Q4 2024 (Megan Graham/Wall Street Journal)
Brazil's Supreme Court authorizes the return of X after the company complied with its demands, including taking down some accounts and appointing a legal agent (Bloomberg)
Samsung removes the Galaxy Z Fold2, which launched in September 2020 for $2,000, from its list of devices that will receive security updates (Scharon Harding/Ars Technica)
ISD: officials in NC and at FEMA, responding to Hurricane Helene, face a flurry of antisemitic attacks largely on X, where some posts received millions of views (Washington Post)
